Dear Heritrixers,

I just received the following mail (my user agent string actually has 
Mozilla/5.0 since that is the default in heritrix...)

I was wondering:

1) Are the concerns of this person justified? My interpretation of the 
string is that I am asking to be served the page that the server would 
serve to Mozilla, but I am also clearly identifying my bot as non-Mozilla?

2) Did anybody investigate what is the "damage" of using a non-standard ua, 
such as whatever name our project has?

Thanks.

Regards,

Marco


-------- Original Message --------
Subject: wacbot UA string
Date: Wed, 23 Nov 2005 00:07:21 +0000
To: baroni@...

Hi there. I have noticed that your wacbot sends the following user
agent string:

Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; wacbot +http://sslmit.unibo.it/~baroni/wacbot)

Are you aware that this infringes on the Mozilla people's trademark?
It's also a generally bad thing for the internet to go around
pretending you're someone else.
The user agent string you should be sending would preferably look
something like this:

wacbot/1.0 (+http://sslmit.unibo.it/~baroni/wacbot)

I'm not affiliated with Mozilla, but would just like to ask nicely
that you change it.
I understand that some sites treat browsers differently if they have
the word "Mozilla" or "compatible" in the UA, but honestly those
sites aren't worth spidering anyway, and their numbers are so few
that a purpose such as yours (linguistics) would be almost unaffected.


-- 
Marco Baroni
SSLMIT, University of Bologna
http://sslmit.unibo.it/~baroni
